member.name: T:Dejaview.DejaViewException
member.summary: Foundation class for all Deja View exceptions. Specific exceptions should use the appropriate subclass.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaViewException.#ctor
member.summary: Use to create a Deja View exception without a message.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaViewException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Use to create a Deja View exception with a specified message.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaViewException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Use to create a Deja View exception with a specified message and an inner exception that gave rise to this exception.
member.param: The exception that gave rise to this exception.

member.name: T:Dejaview.DejaViewNoTagsException
member.summary: Exception indicating that the no Deja View tags could be found in the document.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaViewNoTagsException.#ctor
member.summary: Use to create a DejaViewNoTagsException with the default message.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaViewNoTagsException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Use to create a DejaViewNoTagsException with a specified message.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaViewNoTagsException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Use to create a DejaViewNoTagsException with a specified message and an inner exception that gave rise to this exception.
member.param: The exception that gave rise to this exception.

member.name: T:Dejaview.DejaViewInvalidTagException
member.summary: Exception indicating that the Deja View tags were found in the document but were invalid. If an error occurs while trying to read the Deja View tags, this exception is thrown. It can be used to indicated a deprecated tag format of a potentially incompatible verseion. By all means, we will try to keep all Deja View tag versions compatible, but in the event that this is not possible, this exception is a safety net.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaViewInvalidTagException.#ctor
member.summary: Use to create a DejaViewInvalidTagException with the default message.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaViewInvalidTagException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Use to create a DejaViewInvalidTagException with a specified message.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaViewInvalidTagException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Use to create a DejaViewInvalidTagException with a specified message and an inner exception that gave rise to this exception.
member.param: The exception that gave rise to this exception.

member.summary: Value for this document's zoom level.

member.summary: Width of navigation panel if displayed.

member.summary: Flag for showing the navigation panel.

member.summary: Value flag for showing rulers.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewSet.Equals(Dejaview.DejaviewSet)
member.summary: Method for comparing two DejaviewSet objects. Only the following attributes will be compared: top, left, height, width, state, view type, zoom level, rulers, navigation panel, and ribbon.

member.name: T:Dejaview.DejaviewSet.WindowLocation
member.summary:
Inner class representing the window location of the document. This added dimension allows for retainig a document's viewing location per computer display screen.
The same document can retain its window location on computer C1 with a display resolution of R1 and on computer C2 with a display resolution of R2. Or, computer C1 with R1 and R2 configurations.

member.name: P:Dejaview.DejaviewSet.WindowLocation.DisplayArrangementUID
member.summary: Unique Identifier of the Display Arrangement for the current device. A Display Arrangement represents: (a) the number of screens, (b) the size of each screen, and (c) the order of each screen in relation to one another. This allows Deja View to index a document's view settings per Display Arrangement.

member.name: P:Dejaview.DejaviewSet.WindowLocation.ScreenUID
member.summary: Unique Identifier of the Screen to which this Location belongs.

member.name: P:Dejaview.DejaviewSet.WindowLocation.WindowLeft
member.summary: Left point of Word application window location.

member.name: P:Dejaview.DejaviewSet.WindowLocation.WindowTop
member.summary: Top point of Word application window location.

member.name: P:Dejaview.DejaviewSet.WindowLocation.LastViewed
member.summary: Timestamp of the last time the window was viewed on this screen.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewSet.WindowLocation.SameScreenAs(Dejaview.DejaviewSet.WindowLocation)
member.summary: Method used to see if two WindowLocation objects refer to the same screen.
member.returns: True if the DisplayArrangementUID and ScreenUID match.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewSet.WindowLocation.CompareTo(Dejaview.DejaviewSet.WindowLocation)
member.summary: Method used for comparing and sorting instances of this object. When sorting, the LastViewed property is compared.

member.summary: Standard method for getting an active instance object of this class.

member.summary: Shared instances of this class should be created using Logger.Instance.

member.summary: Logs an event. Takes a LoggerEvent.

member.summary: Logs an event. Automatically creates a LoggerEvent given a string description.

member.name: M:Dejaview.Logger.GetLastEvent
member.summary: Returns the last logged event.

member.summary: Returns an array of all logged event.

member.summary: Timestamp that identifies when this event was raised.

member.name: T:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn
member.summary: Main Add-in class.

member.name: F:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.djvSets
member.summary: Collection that retains the dataset of view settings from documents that have already been viewed. This is especially needful to retain view settings from views on other screens.

member.name: F:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.loggers
member.summary: Collection of unique Logger instances, each keyed to its own ActiveDocument. This is necessary since Microsoft Word uses a shared instance of this Add-in across all open documents.

member.name: F:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.views
member.summary: Collection that retains what documents have had their view set by DV. Each element in this Collection is a bool flag keyed to its own ActiveDocument, indicating if that document's view settings have been applied. This is necessary since Microsoft Word does not reliably fire the DocumentOpen event when a document is opened.

member.name: F:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.saves
member.summary: Collection that retains what documents have been saved. This is used for saving the very last view before closing the document.

member.name: F:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.initialized
member.summary: Used by the InitializeCustom() method to prevent registering duplicate event handlers.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.DejaviewAddIn_Startup(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when this Add-in is initialized.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.DejaviewAddIn_Shutdown(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when this Add-in is closing.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.InitializeCustom
member.summary:
A trigger method to ensure that DejaView initializes a document's settings upon opening each document.
Without this trigger, DejaView properties are not always applied when a document opens because the VSTO plugin is already initialized.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.DejaviewAddIn_NewDocument(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: Method called when a new document is created.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.DejaviewAddIn_DocumentBeforeClose(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Method for intercepting a close and saving the document's view settings just before the document is closed. If the document has not been saved during its current view, then Deja View will not initiate a save. If, however, it has been saved since it was opened, Deja View will save it before closing. If this logic is not in place, then every document opened for view will force a save and thereby alter the modified timestamp unecessarily.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.DejaviewAddIn_DocumentChange
member.summary: Method called when a change occurs in the document. This method is necessary since opening a document that has already been opened and closed within the same instance of MS Word does not always fire ApplicationEvents4_DocumentOpenEventHandler.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.DejaviewAddIn_DocumentOpen(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: Method called when a document is opened.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.DejaviewAddIn_DocumentBeforeSave(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This methods is called immediately before Microsoft Word saves the active document. Here Deja View gathers the current view parameters and sends them to SetDejaviewToDocument be saved in the document.
member.param: Active Word document to be saved

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.SaveDejaviewToDocument(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document,Dejaview.DejaviewSet)
member.summary: Used to save custom Deja View data to the Word document. This is used for preserving viewing settings per document.
member.param: DejaviewSet object to save to document

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.IsLoaded(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: Status of whether or not Deja View tags were loaded for the specified document.
member.returns: Return true if Deja View tags were loaded from doc, otherwise false

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetDejaviewSetFromDocument(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: Retrieve a DejaviewSet from the Word document. This data is stored in Custom XML parts.
member.returns: A DejaviewSet from the Word document

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.RemoveDejaviewFromDocument(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: Remove the DejaviewSet from this Word document. This data is stored in Custom XML parts. This method will also reset the DejaviewSet collection (djvSets).

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetLogger(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: Get the unique Logger for the ActiveDocument.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.Log(System.String,Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: Convenience method for logging an event associated with the ActiveDocument.
member.param: MS Word Document with which this message should be logged.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.Log(System.Exception,Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: Convenience method for logging an Deja View exception associated with the ActiveDocument.
member.param: MS Word Document with which this exception should be logged.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetDejaviewSet(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: This method retrieves the DejaviewSet associated with the ActiveDocument.
member.param: MS Word Document from which to get this DejaviewSet
member.returns: DejaviewSet object associated with the ActiveDocument

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.SetDejaviewSet(Dejaview.DejaviewSet,Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: This method links the provided DejaviewSet object to the ActiveDocument and then stores it in a Collection for easy retrieval. If a DejaviewSet object is already associated with the ActiveDocument that object is simply updated.
member.param: DejaviewSet object to link to the ActiveDocument
MS Word Document to apply this DejaviewSet

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetDefaultDejaviewSet
member.summary: This method creates a new DejaviewSet object based on the current display.
member.returns: DejaviewSet object containing the default view parameters

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetDejaviewSetFromDisplay
member.summary: This method creates a new DejaviewSet object and then assigns values to it based on the current ActiveWindow display parameters.
member.returns: DejaviewSet object containing current view parameters

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.UpdateDejaviewSet(Dejaview.DejaviewSet)
member.summary: Updates the DejaviewSet object associated with the ActiveDocument with the values of the provided DejaviewSet object.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.ShowDocumentView(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document,Dejaview.DejaviewSet)
member.summary: Set the view of a given document.
member.param: DejaviewSet representing the view parameters to be set

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.ShowLocation(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Application,Dejaview.DejaviewSet)
member.summary: This is the main display method of Deja View. It ensures that the document window is showable on the screen. This is helpful when opening documents between computers with a different number of screens.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetDisplayArrangementUID
member.summary: Returns a unique identifier (in hash format) for the current Display Arrangement of the computer.
member.returns: The current Display Arrangement of the computer

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetUID(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document)
member.summary: Returns a unique identifier for a given Document.
member.returns: Unique identifier (hash code) representing the provided Document

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetHashCode(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a SHA1 hashcode for the string provided.
member.param: Input string for the hashcode generator

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetActiveScreenUID
member.summary: Get the Unique Identifier of the Screen displaying the active document.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetScreenUID(System.Windows.Forms.Screen)
member.summary: Get the Unique Identifier of the Screen specified. This ID is comprised of the system assigned device name concatenated with the string representation of the screen's working area.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetScreenNameFromUID(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a human readable name for the screen based on the screen's UID.
For example, a UID is in the form: '\\.\DISPLAY1{X=-1920,Y=0,Width=1920,Height=1050}' The name for this screen would be: 'Display 1 (1920 x 1050) [Left]'

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.DisplayStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Helper method for displaying status to MS Word's status bar.
member.param: Text to display in Word's status bar

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.SetButtonTip
member.summary: Set tooltip for the Remove Button with details from a DejaviewSet

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.GetTags(Dejaview.DejaviewSet)
member.summary: Returns a formatted human readable string with Deja View tag details.
member.returns: Human readable string with tag details

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.CheckForUpdate(System.Object)
member.summary: Thread compatible method invoked to check for updates.

member.name: M:Dejaview.DejaviewAddIn.InternalStartup
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.
